instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Displays on external but No internal image
threads.message:
Good day guys, I have an M1 board, that does not display on the internal screen, No image or backlight, but I get display on an external screen. The board is clean, I have tested with a different screen but no changes, I tested the original screen with another board, and it displays.

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SW_LCD_CONN</SIGNAL>= 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_SW_LCD_CONN</SIGNAL>= 5V
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_1V8_EN</SIGNAL>= 1.8V
<SIGNAL>LPDP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>= 0V
<SIGNAL>I2C_MLB2JERRY_3V3_SCL</SIGNAL>= 3.3V
<SIGNAL>I2C_MLB2JERRY_3V3_SDA</SIGNAL>= 3.3V
<SIGNAL>I2C_ALS_1V8_SCL</SIGNAL>= 1.8V
<SIGNAL>I2C_ALS_1V8_SDA</SIGNAL>= 1.8V


PLEASE HELP ME WITH WHAT NEXT TO DO/CHECK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Displays on external but No internal image
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>LPDP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>= 0V"
M1 expects high voltage, in order to enable internal video.
Did you change the small video cable too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Displays on external but No internal image
threads.message:
YES I CHANGED IT , NO CHANGES , 

"<SIGNAL>LPDP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL>= WHAT DO I NEED TO GET THIS SIGNAL HIGH?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Displays on external but No internal image
threads.message:
This signal comes from LCD assembly.
M1 may have an internal damage and pulls down the signal.
Compare diode mode readings on JP600 lines with good board; w/ and w/o LCD connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 Displays on external but No internal image
